description: Erection of side and rear extensions with installation of 6no rooflights to create new Granny Annex to side of house
decision_conditions: The proposed extension by reason of its size and location would not appear subservient to the parent building and would appear overbearing within the streetscene, failing to comply with Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Council's LDF Core Strategy.

The use of the extension as a granny annex would result in the creation of a separate residential unit which would result in over intensification of the site. failing to comply with Policy DM10 of the Council's LDF Core Strategy (2012).

The assessment of this application has been based on measurements taken from the submitted drawings / plans. If it transpires that the drawings / plans submitted are incorrect this would nullify this decision and you are advised to submit a fresh application with the correct information / drawings. If you carry out development based on incorrect plans you may be liable to the Council taking enforcement action against you.

The applicant is advised that should protected species be found as a result of future development he/she must fulfill his/her duties under the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981 (as amended) and the Conservation of Habitats and Species Regulations 2017 (as amended).

Please provide existing and proposed floor plans at a recognised scale (at 1:50 or 1:100 for example), showing the outline of entire floor plan, not just part and all key dimensions for the proposed works. The plans must also show the direction of North. Although the inclusion of a scale bar is not mandatory, it is encouraged.The submitted floor plans do not have a North point.

The submitted new location plan has red outline in the different address. The submitted old location plan does not show the proposed site in red outline. Please revise the location plan to show the proposed site in red outline.Please submit a copy of an Ordnance Survey based site location plan scaled 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red and adjoining land owned by applicant in blue, showing at least two road frontages and a North point.
